formattedAddress: 15 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 15 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text:
Foul Witch deserves the praise that it has been getting for creating a menu that has exquisite and subtle flavors that really lets the ingredients shine.

There were many standout dishes here but the one I kept thinking back to with how unique it was was the mackerel. Really one of the best bites of food I have eaten.

All of the food is expertly paired with unique wines and excellent knowledgeable staff.

originalText.text: Is it worth the hype? Based on my experience on a recent Friday night, yes. Service, with the exception of the host, was friendly, warm and engaging. We started with a glass of wine at the bar where the bartender let us try a few interesting wines before we landed on an interesting and unique chilled Croatian red wine. He also gave us some recommendations, including an off menu item called Fire and Ice. This dish is a definite MUST. Spreading it on their homemade, warm, and crusty bread was almost a religious experience. Our waitress guided us the rest of the way and encouraged us to look at the menu like a tasting. This is DEFINITELY how you should approach the menu. You are not going to get an entree sized pasta. What you will get though is a few small perfectly cooked ravioli in a delectable broth that explode your tastebuds with a smooth and silky veal. Highlights were the fire and ice, potatoes, and ravioli. Extra points go to the free bread that was phenomenal. It shows they put thought into every element of the meal. We will definitely be back to try more of the menu!

originalText.text: Had a new top three favorite restaurant in NYC  after having dinner here with my girlfriend. Absolutely ask for the “off menu” fire and ice. It was the top dish amongst strong competition. Also, the numerous recommendations to approach the experience like an a-la-cart tasting menu were spot on. Dishes were mostly small, so order lots of things and sharing them to maximize what you get to try!

originalText.text: The bread is amazing! Service is great and attentive. The server wine suggestion was great, as well. Portions are very small and, in my opinion, over price. Appetizers were good, nothing out of the ordinary. The pasta with crab was very good and flavorful. However, they give you a child's portion. The mushrooms' pasta I do not recommend it was not good at all, although I ate it since it was over 30 dollars for about 6 bite pieces. Did not stay for dessert

originalText.text: Fantastic meal that exceeded expectations. Every single dish was delicious - it’s tough to pick a favorite. The signature veal tortellini is a must-order. The bread really is THAT good. Just go!
